info.title: Budibase API
info.description: The public API for Budibase apps and its services.

apiKey.description: The API key of the user to assume for API call.

appId.description: The ID of the app the calls will be executed within the context of, this should start with app_ (production) or app_dev (development).

tableId.name: tableId
tableId.description: The ID of the table which this request is targeting.

viewId.name: viewId
viewId.description: The ID of the view which this request is targeting.

rowId.name: rowId
rowId.description: The ID of the row which this request is targeting.

appId.name: x-budibase-app-id
appId.description: The ID of the app which this request is targeting.

appIdUrl.name: appId
appIdUrl.description: The ID of the app which this request is targeting.

queryId.name: queryId
queryId.description: The ID of the query which this request is targeting.

userId.name: userId
userId.description: The ID of the user which this request is targeting.

metrics.value:
# HELP budibase_os_uptime Time in seconds that the host operating system has been up.
# TYPE budibase_os_uptime counter
budibase_os_uptime 54958
# HELP budibase_os_free_mem Bytes of memory free for usage on the host operating system.
# TYPE budibase_os_free_mem gauge
budibase_os_free_mem 804507648
# HELP budibase_os_total_mem Total bytes of memory on the host operating system.
# TYPE budibase_os_total_mem gauge
budibase_os_total_mem 16742404096
# HELP budibase_os_used_mem Total bytes of memory in use on the host operating system.
# TYPE budibase_os_used_mem gauge
budibase_os_used_mem 15937896448
# HELP budibase_os_load1 Host operating system load average.
# TYPE budibase_os_load1 gauge
budibase_os_load1 1.91
# HELP budibase_os_load5 Host operating system load average.
# TYPE budibase_os_load5 gauge
budibase_os_load5 1.75
# HELP budibase_os_load15 Host operating system load average.
# TYPE budibase_os_load15 gauge
budibase_os_load15 1.56
# HELP budibase_tenant_user_count The number of users created.
# TYPE budibase_tenant_user_count gauge
budibase_tenant_user_count 1
# HELP budibase_tenant_app_count The number of apps created by a user.
# TYPE budibase_tenant_app_count gauge
budibase_tenant_app_count 2
# HELP budibase_tenant_production_app_count The number of apps a user has published.
# TYPE budibase_tenant_production_app_count gauge
budibase_tenant_production_app_count 1
# HELP budibase_tenant_dev_app_count The number of apps a user has unpublished in development.
# TYPE budibase_tenant_dev_app_count gauge
budibase_tenant_dev_app_count 1
# HELP budibase_tenant_db_count The number of couchdb databases including global tables such as _users.
# TYPE budibase_tenant_db_count gauge
budibase_tenant_db_count 3
# HELP budibase_quota_usage_apps The number of apps created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_usage_apps gauge
budibase_quota_usage_apps 1
# HELP budibase_quota_limit_apps The limit on the number of apps that can be created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_limit_apps gauge
budibase_quota_limit_apps 9007199254740991
# HELP budibase_quota_usage_rows The number of database rows used from the quota.
# TYPE budibase_quota_usage_rows gauge
budibase_quota_usage_rows 0
# HELP budibase_quota_limit_rows The limit on the number of rows that can be created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_limit_rows gauge
budibase_quota_limit_rows 9007199254740991
# HELP budibase_quota_usage_plugins The number of plugins in use.
# TYPE budibase_quota_usage_plugins gauge
budibase_quota_usage_plugins 0
# HELP budibase_quota_limit_plugins The limit on the number of plugins that can be created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_limit_plugins gauge
budibase_quota_limit_plugins 9007199254740991
# HELP budibase_quota_usage_user_groups The number of user groups created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_usage_user_groups gauge
budibase_quota_usage_user_groups 0
# HELP budibase_quota_limit_user_groups The limit on the number of user groups that can be created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_limit_user_groups gauge
budibase_quota_limit_user_groups 9007199254740991
# HELP budibase_quota_usage_queries The number of queries used in the current month.
# TYPE budibase_quota_usage_queries gauge
budibase_quota_usage_queries 0
# HELP budibase_quota_limit_queries The limit on the number of queries for the current month.
# TYPE budibase_quota_limit_queries gauge
budibase_quota_limit_queries 9007199254740991
# HELP budibase_quota_usage_automations The number of automations used in the current month.
# TYPE budibase_quota_usage_automations gauge
budibase_quota_usage_automations 0
# HELP budibase_quota_limit_automations The limit on the number of automations that can be created.
# TYPE budibase_quota_limit_automations gauge
budibase_quota_limit_automations 9007199254740991

ApiKeyAuth.name: x-budibase-api-key
ApiKeyAuth.description: Your individual API key, this will provide access based on the configured RBAC settings of your user.

url.description: The URL by which the app is accessed, this must be URL encoded.
The URL by which the app is accessed, this must be URL encoded.

status.description: The status of the app, stating it if is the development or published version.

createdAt.description: States when the app was created, will be constant. Stored in ISO format.

updatedAt.description: States the last time the app was updated - stored in ISO format.

version.description: States the version of the Budibase client this app is currently based on.

tenantId.description: In a multi-tenant environment this will state the tenant this app is within.

lockedBy.description: The user this app is currently being built by.

url.description: The URL by which the app is accessed, this must be URL encoded.

status.description: The status of the app, stating it if is the development or published version.

createdAt.description: States when the app was created, will be constant. Stored in ISO format.

updatedAt.description: States the last time the app was updated - stored in ISO format.

version.description: States the version of the Budibase client this app is currently based on.

tenantId.description: In a multi-tenant environment this will state the tenant this app is within.

lockedBy.description: The user this app is currently being built by.

status.description: Status of the deployment, whether it succeeded or failed

appUrl.description: The URL of the published app

encryptPassword.description: An optional password used to encrypt the export.

excludeRows.description: Set whether the internal table rows should be excluded from the export.

row.description: The row to be created/updated, based on the table schema.

additionalProperties.description: Key value properties of any type, depending on the table schema.

data.description: An array of rows, these will each contain an _id field which can be used to update or delete them.

bookmark.description: If pagination in use, this should be provided.

hasNextPage.description: If pagination in use, this will determine if there is another page to fetch.

data.description: The row to be created/updated, based on the table schema.

additionalProperties.description: Key value properties of any type, depending on the table schema.

tableId.description: The ID of the table this row comes from.

primaryDisplay.description: The name of the column which should be used in relationship tags when relating to this table.

constraints.description: A constraint can be applied to the column which will be validated against when a row is saved.

presence.description: Defines whether the column is required or not.

autocolumn.description: Defines whether the column is automatically generated.

fieldName.description: The name of the column which a relationship column is related to in another table.

tableId.description: The ID of the table which a relationship column is related to.

relationshipType.description: Defines the type of relationship that this column will be used for.

through.description: When using a SQL table that contains many to many relationships this defines the table the relationships are linked through.

foreignKey.description: When using a SQL table that contains a one to many relationship this defines the foreign key.

throughFrom.description: When using a SQL table that utilises a through table, this defines the primary key in the through table for this table.

throughTo.description: When using a SQL table that utilises a through table, this defines the primary key in the through table for the related table.

constraints.description: A constraint can be applied to the column which will be validated against when a row is saved.

presence.description: Defines whether the column is required or not.

autocolumn.description: Defines whether the column is automatically generated.

formula.description: Defines a Handlebars or JavaScript formula to use, note that Javascript formulas are expected to be provided in the base64 format.

formulaType.description: Defines whether this is a static or dynamic formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the column, most explain themselves, a link column is a relationship.

constraints.description: A constraint can be applied to the column which will be validated against when a row is saved.

presence.description: Defines whether the column is required or not.

autocolumn.description: Defines whether the column is automatically generated.

executeQuery.description: The parameters required for executing a query.

parameters.description: This contains the required parameters for the query, this depends on query type, setup and bindings.

additionalProperties.description: Key value properties of any type, depending on the query output schema.

pagination.description: For supported query types (currently on REST) pagination can be performed using these properties.

page.description: The page which has been returned from a previous query.

limit.description: The number of rows to return per page.

data.description: The data response from the query.

extra.description: Extra information that is not part of the main data, e.g. headers.

headers.description: If carrying out a REST request, this will contain the response headers.

raw.description: The raw query response, as a string.

pagination.description: If pagination is supported, this will contain the bookmark/anchor information for it.

datasourceId.description: The ID of the datasource the query belongs to.

parameters.description: The bindings which are required to perform this query.

fields.description: The fields that are used to perform this query, e.g. the sql statement

queryVerb.description: The verb that describes this query.

schema.description: The schema of the data returned when the query is executed.

transformer.description: The JavaScript transformer function, applied after the query responds with data.

readable.description: Whether the query has readable data.

datasourceId.description: The ID of the datasource the query belongs to.

parameters.description: The bindings which are required to perform this query.

fields.description: The fields that are used to perform this query, e.g. the sql statement

queryVerb.description: The verb that describes this query.

schema.description: The schema of the data returned when the query is executed.

transformer.description: The JavaScript transformer function, applied after the query responds with data.

readable.description: Whether the query has readable data.

email.description: The email address of the user, this must be unique.

password.description: The password of the user if using password based login - this will never be returned. This can be left out of subsequent requests (updates) and will be enriched back into the user structure.

status.description: The status of the user, if they are active.

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

forceResetPassword.description: If set to true forces the user to reset their password on first login.

builder.description: Describes if the user is a builder user or not. This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

global.description: If set to true the user will be able to build any app in the system.

admin.description: Describes if the user is an admin user or not. This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

global.description: If set to true the user will be able to administrate the system.

roles.description: Contains the roles of the user per app (assuming they are not a builder user). This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

additionalProperties.description: A map of app ID (production app ID, minus the _dev component) to a role ID, e.g. ADMIN.

email.description: The email address of the user, this must be unique.

password.description: The password of the user if using password based login - this will never be returned. This can be left out of subsequent requests (updates) and will be enriched back into the user structure.

status.description: The status of the user, if they are active.

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

forceResetPassword.description: If set to true forces the user to reset their password on first login.

builder.description: Describes if the user is a builder user or not. This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

global.description: If set to true the user will be able to build any app in the system.

admin.description: Describes if the user is an admin user or not. This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

global.description: If set to true the user will be able to administrate the system.

roles.description: Contains the roles of the user per app (assuming they are not a builder user). This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

additionalProperties.description: A map of app ID (production app ID, minus the _dev component) to a role ID, e.g. ADMIN.

email.description: The email address of the user, this must be unique.

password.description: The password of the user if using password based login - this will never be returned. This can be left out of subsequent requests (updates) and will be enriched back into the user structure.

status.description: The status of the user, if they are active.

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

forceResetPassword.description: If set to true forces the user to reset their password on first login.

builder.description: Describes if the user is a builder user or not. This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

global.description: If set to true the user will be able to build any app in the system.

admin.description: Describes if the user is an admin user or not. This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

global.description: If set to true the user will be able to administrate the system.

roles.description: Contains the roles of the user per app (assuming they are not a builder user). This field can only be set on a business or enterprise license.

additionalProperties.description: A map of app ID (production app ID, minus the _dev component) to a role ID, e.g. ADMIN.

allOr.description: Specifies that a row should be returned if it satisfies any of the specified options, rather than requiring it to fulfill all the search parameters. This defaults to false, meaning AND logic will be used.

string.description: A map of field name to the string to search for, this will look for rows that have a value starting with the string value.

additionalProperties.description: The value to search for in the column.

fuzzy.description: Searches for a sub-string within a string column, e.g. searching for 'dib' will match 'Budibase'.

range.description: Searches within a range, the format of this must be in the format of an object with a "low" and "high" property.

equal.description: Searches for rows that have a column value that is exactly the value set.

notEqual.description: Searches for any row which does not contain the specified column value.

empty.description: Searches for rows which do not contain the specified column. The object should simply contain keys of the column names, these can map to any value.

notEmpty.description: Searches for rows which have the specified column.

oneOf.description: Searches for rows which have a column value that is any of the specified values. The format of this must be columnName -> [value1, value2].

contains.description: Searches for a value, or set of values in array column types (such as a multi-select). If an array of search options is provided then it must match all.

notContains.description: The logical inverse of contains. Only works on array column types. If an array of values is passed, the row must not match any of them to be returned in the response.

containsAny.description: As with the contains search, only works on array column types and searches for any of the provided values when given an array.

paginate.description: Enables pagination, by default this is disabled.

bookmark.description: If retrieving another page, the bookmark from the previous request must be supplied.

limit.description: The maximum number of rows to return, useful when paginating, for internal tables this will be limited to 1000, for SQL tables it will be 5000.

sort.description: A set of parameters describing the sort behaviour of the search.

order.description: The order of the sort, by default this is ascending.

column.description: The name of the column by which the rows will be sorted.

type.description: Defines whether the column should be treated as a string or as numbers when sorting.

name.description: The name to be used when searching - this will be used in a case insensitive starts with match.

appId.description: The app that the users should have app builder privileges granted for.

appBuilder.description: Allow setting users to builders per app.

builder.description: Add/remove global builder permissions from the list of users.

admin.description: Add/remove global admin permissions from the list of users.

roleId.description: The role ID, such as BASIC, ADMIN or a custom role ID.

appId.description: The app that the role relates to.

role.description: Add/remove a per-app role, such as BASIC, ADMIN etc.

userIds.description: The user IDs to be updated to add/remove the specified roles.

appId.description: The app that the users should have app builder privileges granted for.

appBuilder.description: Allow setting users to builders per app.

builder.description: Add/remove global builder permissions from the list of users.

admin.description: Add/remove global admin permissions from the list of users.

roleId.description: The role ID, such as BASIC, ADMIN or a custom role ID.

appId.description: The app that the role relates to.

role.description: Add/remove a per-app role, such as BASIC, ADMIN etc.

userIds.description: The user IDs to be updated to add/remove the specified roles.

tableId.description: The ID of the table this view is based on.

type.description: The type of view - standard (empty value) or calculation.

primaryDisplay.description: A column used to display rows from this view - usually used when rendered in tables.

logicalOperator.description: When using groups this defines whether all of the filters must match, or only one of them.

onEmptyFilter.description: If no filters match, should the view return all rows, or no rows.

groups.description: A grouping of filters to be applied.

logicalOperator.description: When using groups this defines whether all of the filters must match, or only one of them.

filters.description: A list of filters to apply

operator.description: The type of search operation which is being performed.

field.description: The field in the view to perform the search on.

value.description: The value to search for - the type will depend on the operator in use.

groups.description: A grouping of filters to be applied.

logicalOperator.description: When using groups this defines whether all of the filters must match, or only one of them.

filters.description: A list of filters to apply

operator.description: The type of search operation which is being performed.

field.description: The field in the view to perform the search on.

value.description: The value to search for - the type will depend on the operator in use.

field.description: The field from the table/view schema to sort on.

order.description: The order in which to sort.

type.description: The type of sort to perform (by number, or by alphabetically).

visible.description: Defines whether the column is visible or not - rows retrieved/updated through this view will not be able to access it.

readonly.description: When used in combination with 'visible: true' the column will be visible in row responses but cannot be updated.

order.description: A number defining where the column shows up in tables, lowest being first.

width.description: A width for the column, defined in pixels - this affects rendering in tables.

column.description: If this is a relationship column, we can set the columns we wish to include

calculationType.description: This column should be built from a calculation, specifying a type and field. It is important to note when a calculation is configured all non-calculation columns will be used for grouping.

field.description: The field from the table to perform the calculation on.

distinct.description: Can be used in tandem with the count calculation type, to count unique entries.

post.summary: Import an app to an existing app
post.description: This endpoint is only available on a business or enterprise license.

encryptedPassword.description: Password for the export if it is encrypted.

post.description: This endpoint is only available on a business or enterprise license.

200.description: A gzip tarball containing the app export, encrypted if password provided.

schema.example: Tarball containing database and object store contents...

post.description: Based on application properties (currently only name) search for applications.

200.description: Returns the applications that were found based on the search parameters.

get.description: Output metrics in OpenMetrics format compatible with Prometheus

post.description: Queries which have been created within a Budibase app can be executed using this,

200.description: Returns the result of the query execution.

post.description: Based on query properties (currently only name) search for queries.

200.description: Returns the queries found based on the search parameters.

post.summary: Assign a role to a list of users
post.description: This is a business/enterprise only endpoint

200.description: Returns a list of updated user IDs

post.summary: Un-assign a role from a list of users
post.description: This is a business/enterprise only endpoint

200.description: Returns a list of updated user IDs

post.description: Creates a row within the specified table.

200.description: Returns the created row, including the ID which has been generated for it. This can be found in the Budibase portal, viewed under the developer information.

put.description: Updates a row within the specified table.

200.description: Returns the created row, including the ID which has been generated for it.

delete.description: Deletes a row within the specified table.

200.description: Returns the deleted row, including the ID which has been generated for it.

get.description: This gets a single row, it will be enriched with the full related rows, rather than the squashed "primaryDisplay" format returned by the search endpoint.

200.description: The response will contain an array of rows that match the search parameters.

post.summary: Search for rows in a view

200.description: The response will contain an array of rows that match the search parameters.

post.description: Create a table, this could be internal or external.

200.description: Returns the created table, including the ID which has been generated for it. This can be internal or external datasources.

put.description: Update a table, this could be internal or external.

delete.description: Delete a table, this could be internal or external.

get.description: Lookup a table, this could be internal or external.

post.description: Based on table properties (currently only name) search for tables. This could be an internal or an external table.

200.description: Returns the found tables, based on the search parameters.

post.description: Based on user properties (currently only name) search for users.

200.description: Returns the found users based on search parameters.

post.description: Create a view, this can be against an internal or external table.

200.description: Returns the created view, including the ID which has been generated for it.

put.description: Update a view, this can be against an internal or external table.

delete.description: Delete a view, this can be against an internal or external table.

get.description: Lookup a view, this could be internal or external.

post.description: Based on view properties (currently only name) search for views.

200.description: Returns the found views, based on the search parameters.
